thread.title: Best photos of the day: An orchid mantis and starry skies
thread.title_full: Best photos of the day: An orchid mantis and starry skies

author: Sadie Gould
title: Best photos of the day: An orchid mantis and starry skies
text:
Best photos of the day: An orchid mantis and starry skies Best photos of the day: An orchid mantis and starry skies View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of photo highlights from around the world, including a cunning flower mimic and a twinkly night Sadie Gould Thursday 16 March 2017 12.42 GMT The Hague, the Netherlands Prime minister and VVD party leader Mark Rutte arrives to deliver a speech after winning the general election Photograph: John Thys/AFP/Getty Jakarta, Indonesia Villagers whose feet are cast in cement blocks sit on a chairs as part of four days of protests to draw attention to what they say is environmental damage to their farmland from a cement factory Photograph: Beawiharta/Reuters Stars twinkle over treetops in a forest Photograph: Patrick Pleul/AFP/Getty Mosul, Iraq A police officer weeps at the site of a mass grave containing about two dozen people, many of them children, in an area recently retaken from Islamic State militants Photograph: Christian Stephen/AP Geert Wilders, leader of the Party for Freedom reacts to the general election results Photograph: Remko de Waal/EPA Craig Mathews holds a sign with protesters before Donald Trump visits for a rally Photograph: DDP USA/Rex/Shutterstock Liaocheng, China Farmers working in a wheat field. Genetically modified organisms are banned in China but the debate over whether to introduce them rages at the annual session of parliament Photograph: STR/AFP/Getty Images São Paulo, Brazil A protester with a sticker reading: ‘No right to less’ attends a demonstration against changes to the pension scheme Photograph: Fernando Bizerra Jr/EPA McAllen, US A woman raises her hands as a US Customs and Border Protection helicopter flies overhead near the Mexican border. The organisation has announced that illegal crossings along the south-west border with Mexico dropped by 40% in February Photograph: John Moore/Getty Images Beijing, China Members of the Saudi delegation wait for the arrival of China’s president, Xi Jinping, and Saudi king, Salman bin Abdulaziz al-Saud, before a welcoming ceremony Photograph: Thomas Peter/Reuters Padang, Indonesia An orchid mantis ( Hymenopus coronatus ) perches on the head of a frog hanging from a tree branch Photograph: Riau/Barcroft
